Column Comment.0: POINT IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a spatial description point.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. Is typically used toindicate the level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.3: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.4: DATUM ELEVATION: The elevation of the vertical datum used to measure theposition of downhole positions, such as geophones.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: ELEVATION: The elevation of the point relative to the survey system or the TVD(vertial depth) of a pont that is in the subsurface. Most commonly, this will be used forwell related seismic, where source or receiver points may be located in the bore hole.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: LATITUDE: The "selected" latitude for this node relative to the Equator.
Column Comment.11: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate systemare usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.12: LOCATION QUALITY: Indicates the quality or degree of reliablity of a location.
Column Comment.13: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.14: LONGITUDE: The "selected" longitude for this node relative to the prime meridian ofthe Geodetic Datum.
Column Comment.15: MEASURED DEPTH: the Measured Depth of a position, such as the shot or receiverplacement, below ground or sea level.
Column Comment.17: POINT LABEL: the label to be associated with the point when mapping or reporting,such as a well identifier, seismic point name, facility name etc.
Column Comment.18: POINT NUMBER: A numeric value associated with a point, such as a numberassigned to a seismic point by processors.
Column Comment.19: NODE POSITION: The position of a point, often the position of a node in a well bore,or some other node in a system. For example: surface point, bottomhole point,kick-off point, ....
Column Comment.20: POINT SEQUENCE NUMBER: In the case where a point is one of a sequence, youcan use this column to order the points in spatial sequence.
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: REFERNCE DATUM: the datum to which the elevations or depths have beenreferenced, such as Mean Sea Level.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.25: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.26: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
